page.title: 10FLOODS IN EXETER.
page.content: Mr.Hooper,caretaker of Montgomery School,remembers when the River Exe burst its banks.In Buller Road there is a house showing the level of the flood on October 21st,1960.Mr.Hooper says,"It was the most frightening sight I have ever seen.Brown water gushed down Manor Road and Redvers Road into School from Okehampton Road,breaking up cars,smashing windows and uprooting trees." Children were evacuated from School using the meals van and with the help of the Marines.Mr.Hooper carried an old lady in Brunswick Street upstairs to safety.She was sitting on a chair ankle deep in water as her slippers floated out through the door of her home. Flood relief channels have been constructed to prevent this happening again.
